data.enText: move round
to move or make sth move around a central point

data.chText: 汽车的轮子开始转动起来。
data.enText: The wheels of the car began to turn.
I can't get the screw to turn.
He turned the key in the lock.
She turned the wheel sharply to the left.
change position/direction
to move your body or part of your body so as to face or start moving in a different direction
We turned and headed for home.
She turned to look at me.
He turned back to his work.
I turned away and looked out of the window.
He turned his back to the wall.
She turned her head away.
to move sth so that it is in a different position or facing a different direction

data.chText: 她把椅子翻转过来修理。
data.enText: She turned the chair on its side to repair it.

data.chText: 你把针织套衫里面翻过来再洗。
data.enText: Turn the sweater inside out before you wash it.
to change the direction you are moving or travelling in; to make sth change the direction it is moving in

data.chText: 他拐进了一条狭窄的街道。
data.enText: He turned into a narrow street.

data.chText: 那男人转过街角就没影了。
data.enText: The man turned the corner and disappeared.

data.chText: 我转弯把汽车开进了停车场。
data.enText: I turned the car into the car park.
to curve in a particular direction

data.chText: 这条路过了教堂之后向左转弯。
data.enText: The road turns to the left after the church.
aim/point
to aim or point sth in a particular direction

data.chText: 警察把高压水枪对准了闹事者。
data.enText: Police turned water cannon on the rioters.
He turned the gun on himself.

data.chText: 她看了看他，然后又把注意力转回到我的身上。
data.enText: She looked at him then turned her attention back to me.

data.chText: 他想起了自己已故的妻子。
data.enText: His thoughts turned to his dead wife.
of tide in sea
to start to come in or go out

data.chText: 涨潮了，我们最好回去吧。
data.enText: The tide is turning─we'd better get back.
let sb/sth go
to make or let sb/sth go into a particular place or state

data.chText: 他们把马松开放到牧场里。
data.enText: They turned the horse into the field.
to turn the dogs loose
fold
to fold sth in a particular way
She turned down the blankets and climbed into bed.

data.chText: 他竖起大衣领子，冒雨匆匆走了。
data.enText: He turned up the collar of his coat and hurried out into the rain.
cartwheel/somersault
to perform a movement by moving your body in a circle
to turn cartwheels/somersaults
page
if you turn a page of a book or magazine, you move it so that you can read the next page

data.chText: 他坐在那里无所事事地翻着书。
data.enText: He sat turning the pages idly.
Turn to p.23.
game
if a game turns or sb turns it, it changes the way it is developing so that a different person or team starts to win
become
to change into a particular state or condition; to make sth do this
The leaves were turning brown.
The weather has turned cold.

data.chText: 我们不给他钱时，他变得穷凶极恶。
data.enText: He turned nasty when we refused to give him the money.
He decided to turn professional .

data.chText: 炎热的天气使得牛奶变酸了。
data.enText: The heat turned the milk sour.

data.chText: 她听到这个消息时面如死灰。
data.enText: She turned a deathly shade of white when she heard the news.

data.chText: 他以前是个律师，现在成为政治家了。
data.enText: He's a lawyer turned politician (= he used to be a lawyer but is now a politician) .
age/time

data.chText: 到达，超过（某一年龄或时间）

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to reach or pass a particular age or time
She turns 21 in June.
It's turned midnight.
stomach
when your stomach turns or sth turns your stomach, you feel as though you will vomit
wood
to shape sth on a lathe
to turn a chair leg
turned boxes and bowls

data.chText: 大多数含 turn 的习语，都可在该等习语中的名词及形容词相关词条找到，如 not turn a hair 在词条 hair 下。
data.enText: Most idioms containing turn are at the entries for the nouns and adjectives in the idioms, for example not turn a hair is at hair .
as it/things turned out

data.chText: 正如后来表明的；果然如此；果不其然
data.enText: as was shown or proved by later events
I didn't need my umbrella, as it turned out (= because it didn't rain) .
be well, badly, etc. turned out

data.chText: 穿着打扮得好（或不好等）
data.enText: to be well, badly, etc. dressed
turn round/around and do sth

data.chText: （用以报告令人吃惊或不快的言行）竟会
data.enText: used to report what sb says or does, when this is surprising or annoying

data.chText: 我为她做了这么多，她怎么竟说出那种话来？
data.enText: How could she turn round and say that, after all I've done for her?
turn against sb
turn sb against sb
to stop or make sb stop being friendly towards sb
She turned against her old friend.

data.chText: 他离婚后企图教唆子女反对他们的母亲。
data.enText: After the divorce he tried to turn the children against their mother.
turn around/round
turn sb/sth around/round
to change position or direction so as to face the other way; to make sb/sth do this

data.chText: 转过身去让我看看你的后背。
data.enText: Turn around and let me look at your back.

data.chText: 我把椅子转过来面向火炉。
data.enText: I turned my chair round to face the fire.
turn around/round
turn sth↔around/round

data.chText: （使企业、经济等）好转，扭转，有起色
data.enText: if a business, economy, etc. turns around or sb turns it around , it starts being successful after it has been unsuccessful for a time
turn sb↔away (from sth)

data.chText: 把某人拒之门外；不准某人进入
data.enText: to refuse to allow sb to enter a place

data.chText: 体育场满座，数百人被拒之门外。
data.enText: Hundreds of people were turned away from the stadium (= because it was full) .

data.chText: 他们无处安身，所以我不能把他们打发走。
data.enText: They had nowhere to stay so I couldn't turn them away.
turn back
turn sb/sth↔back
to return the way you have come; to make sb/sth do this

data.chText: 天气变得非常恶劣，他们不得不循原路折回。
data.enText: The weather became so bad that they had to turn back.

data.chText: 我们说过要干这事，不能反悔。
data.enText: We said we would do it─there can be no turning back.

data.chText: 我们的汽车在边境被挡了回来。
data.enText: Our car was turned back at the border.
turn sb/sth↔down

data.chText: 拒绝，顶回（提议、建议或提议人）
data.enText: to reject or refuse to consider an offer, a proposal, etc. or the person who makes it

data.chText: 她为什么谢绝你的邀请？
data.enText: Why did she turn down your invitation?

data.chText: 他迄今申请了十份工作都遭到拒绝。
data.enText: He has been turned down for ten jobs so far.

data.chText: 他请求她嫁给他，但是她回绝了。
data.enText: He asked her to marry him but she turned him down.
turn sth↔down
to reduce the noise, heat, etc. produced by a piece of equipment by moving its controls
Please turn the volume down.

data.chText: 他把灯光调得暗了一些。
data.enText: He turned the lights down low.
turn in
to face or curve towards the centre
Her feet turn in.
to go to bed
turn sb↔in

data.chText: 把…扭送（到警察局）；使自首
data.enText: to take sb to the police or sb in authority because they have committed a crime

data.chText: 她扬言要把他交给警方。
data.enText: She threatened to turn him in to the police.

data.chText: 他决定到警察局去自首。
data.enText: He decided to turn himself in.
turn sth↔in

data.chText: 交还，退还（不再需要的东西）
data.enText: to give back sth that you no longer need

data.chText: 你离开大楼时必须交还通行证。
data.enText: You must turn in your pass when you leave the building.
to give sth to sb in authority

data.chText: 他们递交了一份有8万人签名的请愿书。
data.enText: They turned in a petition with 80 000 signatures.

data.chText: 我连星期一的作业还没交呢。
data.enText: I haven't even turned in Monday's work yet.

data.chText: 取得（分数）；完成（表演）；获得（利润）
data.enText: to achieve a score, performance, profit, etc.

data.chText: 上届冠军表现十分出色，卫冕成功。
data.enText: The champion turned in a superb performance to retain her title.
turn in on yourself

data.chText: 忙于自己的事情而不与人交往；闭门谢客
data.enText: to become too concerned with your own problems and stop communicating with others
turn (from sth) into sth
to become sth

data.chText: 我们梦想的假日变成了一场噩梦。
data.enText: Our dream holiday turned into a nightmare.

data.chText: 一年内，她从问题儿童变成了模范学生。
data.enText: In one year she turned from a problem child into a model student.
turn sb/sth (from sth) into sth
to make sb/sth become sth

data.chText: 十年大狱使他变成了一个老头。
data.enText: Ten years of prison had turned him into an old man.

data.chText: 王子被女巫变成了一只青蛙。
data.enText: The prince was turned into a frog by the witch.
turn off
turn off sth
to leave a road in order to travel on another

data.chText: 这儿是我们换道的地方吗？
data.enText: Is this where we turn off?

data.chText: 那架喷气式飞机开始拐出主跑道。
data.enText: The jet began to turn off the main runway.
turn off
to stop listening to or thinking about sb/sth

data.chText: 我听不懂讲课，所以也就不听了。
data.enText: I couldn't understand the lecture so I just turned off.
turn sb↔off
to make sb feel bored or not interested

data.chText: 大选中的两位候选人都让人觉得扫兴。
data.enText: People had been turned off by both candidates in the election.

data.chText: 使（异性）失去兴趣；使厌恶
data.enText: to stop sb feeling sexually attracted; to make sb have a feeling of disgust
turn sth↔off

data.chText: 关掉，截断（电流、煤气、水等）
data.enText: to stop the flow of electricity, gas, water, etc. by moving a switch, button, etc.
to turn off the light
Please turn the television off before you go to bed.
turn on sb
to attack sb suddenly and unexpectedly

data.chText: 那两条狗突然互相撕咬了起来。
data.enText: The dogs suddenly turned on each other.

data.chText: 你们怎么突然都冲我来了？
data.enText: Why are you all turning on me (= criticizing or blaming me) ?
turn on sth
to depend on sth

data.chText: 事情主要取决于当前和谈的结果。
data.enText: Much turns on the outcome of the current peace talks.
to have sth as its main topic

data.chText: 这次讨论的主要议题是提高标准的必要性。
data.enText: The discussion turned on the need to raise standards.
turn sb↔on
to make sb excited or interested, especially sexually

data.chText: 我对爵士乐从未真正产生过兴趣。
data.enText: Jazz has never really turned me on.

data.chText: 她看到穿制服的男人就欲火攻心。
data.enText: She gets turned on by men in uniform.
turn sb on (to sth)

data.chText: 使对…感兴趣；使首次使用
data.enText: to make sb become interested in sth or to use sth for the first time

data.chText: 他使她对爵士乐产生了兴趣。
data.enText: He turned her on to jazz.
turn sth↔on

data.chText: 接通（电流、煤气、水等）；打开
data.enText: to start the flow of electricity, gas, water, etc. by moving a switch, button, etc.
to turn on the heating
I'll turn the television on.

data.chText: 他确实懂得如何一展魅力。
data.enText: He really knows how to turn on the charm (= suddenly become pleasant and attractive) .
turn out
to be present at an event

data.chText: 有一大群人出来观看游行队伍。
data.enText: A vast crowd turned out to watch the procession.

before.chText: 与副词或形容词连用，或用于以how引导的疑问句
before.enText: used with an adverb or adjective, or in questions with how

data.enText: to happen in a particular way; to develop or end in a particular way

data.chText: 尽管我们都很担心，结果一切都顺利。
data.enText: Despite our worries everything turned out well.

data.chText: 很难说子女将来的发展怎样。
data.enText: You never know how your children will turn out.

data.chText: 如果那天下雨的话，我们可能得改变计划。
data.enText: If the day turns out wet, we may have to change our plans.
to point away from the centre
Her toes turn out.
to be discovered to be; to prove to be

data.chText: 她原来是我姐姐的朋友。
data.enText: It turned out that she was a friend of my sister.

data.chText: 这工作结果比我们想象的要难。
data.enText: The job turned out to be harder than we thought.

data.chText: 他们向我们提供的房子原来是很小的公寓套间。
data.enText: The house they had offered us turned out to be a tiny apartment.
turn sb/sth↔out

data.chText: 制造；生产；以（…装束等）出现
data.enText: to produce sb/sth

data.chText: 这家工厂每周生产900辆汽车。
data.enText: The factory turns out 900 cars a week.
turn sb out (of/from sth)
to force sb to leave a place
turn sth↔out
to switch a light or a source of heat off
Remember to turn out the lights when you go to bed.
to clean sth thoroughly by removing the contents and organizing them again
to turn out the attic
to empty sth, especially your pockets
to make sth point away from the centre
She turned her toes out.
turn over
to change position so that the other side is facing towards the outside or the top

data.chText: 你若翻个身，也许入睡容易些。
data.enText: If you turn over you might find it easier to get to sleep.

data.chText: 汽车打滑向一侧翻倒了。
data.enText: The car skidded and turned over.
The smell made my stomach turn over (= made me feel sick) .
to start or to continue to run
to change to another channel when you are watching television
turn over sth

data.chText: 营业额为…；做金额为…的生意
data.enText: to do business worth a particular amount of money in a particular period of time

data.chText: 这家公司一年的营业额为350万英镑。
data.enText: The company turns over £3.5 million a year.
turn sth↔over
to make sth change position so that the other side is facing towards the outside or the top

data.chText: 把肉的一面烤黄，然后翻转过来，再烤另一面。
data.enText: Brown the meat on one side, then turn it over and brown the other side.
to think about sth carefully

data.chText: 她脑子里不断琢磨当天发生的事。
data.enText: She kept turning over the events of the day in her mind.
to sell goods and replace them

data.chText: 超级市场的货物周转得很快。
data.enText: A supermarket will turn over its stock very rapidly.
to steal from a place

data.chText: 盗贼把这所房子盗窃一空。
data.enText: Burglars had turned the house over.
to make an engine start running
turn sb↔over to sb

data.chText: 移交，送交（他人看管，尤指当局）
data.enText: to deliver sb to the control or care of sb else, especially sb in authority

data.chText: 海关官员把那个男子移交给警方看管。
data.enText: Customs officials turned the man over to the police.
turn sth↔over to sb
to give the control of sth to sb

data.chText: 他把这个企业交给了女儿管理。
data.enText: He turned the business over to his daughter.
turn sth↔over to sth
to change the use or function of sth

data.chText: 这家工厂转产飞机部件。
data.enText: The factory was turned over to the manufacture of aircraft parts.
turn to sb/sth
to go to sb/sth for help, advice, etc.
She has nobody she can turn to.
turn up

data.chText: （尤指失去后偶然）被发现，被找到
data.enText: to be found, especially by chance, after being lost

data.chText: 别为那封信担心，我相信会找到的。
data.enText: Don't worry about the letter─I'm sure it'll turn up.
to arrive

data.chText: 我们约好7:30碰头，但她根本没露面。
data.enText: We arranged to meet at 7.30, but she never turned up.
to happen, especially by chance

data.chText: 他仍然在希望会有机会出现。
data.enText: He's still hoping something (= for example, a job or a piece of luck) will turn up.
turn sth↔up
to increase the sound, heat, etc. of a piece of equipment

data.chText: 你能把电视机的音量开大些吗？
data.enText: Could you turn the TV up?
The music was turned up loud.

data.chText: 将（衣服的底边）折起缝好；改短
data.enText: to make a piece of clothing shorter by folding and sewing it up at the bottom
to find sth

data.chText: 我们辛辛苦苦跟踪他，却无功而返。
data.enText: Our efforts to trace him turned up nothing.
movement
an act of turning sb/sth around
Give the handle a few turns.
of road/vehicle
a change in direction in a vehicle

data.chText: 向左 / 右拐入西大街。
data.enText: Make a left/right turn into West Street.
a bend or corner in a road
a lane full of twists and turns
time
the time when sb in a group of people should or is allowed to do sth
When it's your turn, take another card.
Please wait your turn .
Whose turn is it to cook?

data.chText: 我睡觉时，史蒂夫接着开车。
data.enText: Steve took a turn driving while I slept.
change

data.chText: （异乎寻常或意外的）变化，转变
data.enText: an unusual or unexpected change in what is happening
a surprising turn of events

data.chText: 他的健康状况突然恶化。
data.enText: His health has taken a turn for the worse (= suddenly got worse) .

data.chText: 在以后的几周里，事态急转直下。
data.enText: Events took a dramatic turn in the weeks that followed.

data.chText: 这部书时而妙趣横生，时而悲悲戚戚。
data.enText: The book is, by turns , funny and very sad.
performance
a short performance or piece of entertainment such as a song, etc.

data.chText: 每个人都登台表演了一个小节目。
data.enText: Everyone got up on stage to do a turn.
walk
a short walk

data.chText: 我们在公园里转了一圈。
data.enText: We took a turn around the park.
illness
a feeling of illness
a funny turn (= a feeling that you may faint)
at every turn
everywhere or every time you try and do sth
At every turn I met with disappointment.
(do sb) a good turn

data.chText: （为某人做）好事，善事；（做）有助于某人的事
data.enText: (to do) sth that helps sb

data.chText: 好啦，这就是我今天做的好事。
data.enText: Well, that's my good turn for the day.
done to a turn
cooked for exactly the right amount of time
give sb a turn

data.chText: 使大吃一惊；吓某人一跳
data.enText: to frighten or shock sb
in turn
one after the other in a particular order
The children called out their names in turn.
as a result of sth in a series of events

data.chText: 增加生产会继而增加利润。
data.enText: Increased production will, in turn, lead to increased profits.
one good turn deserves another

data.chText: 善须善报；要以德报德；好人应得好报
data.enText: you should help sb who has helped you
on the turn
going to change soon
His luck is on the turn.
speak/talk out of turn

data.chText: 说话出格（或冒失、鲁莽、不合时宜）
data.enText: to say sth that you should not because it is the wrong situation or because it offends sb
take turns (in sth/to do sth)
take it in turns
if people take turns or take it in turns to do sth, they do it one after the other to make sure it is done fairly
The male and female birds take turns in sitting on the eggs.
We take it in turns to do the housework.
the turn of the century/year

data.chText: 世纪之交；新年伊始；辞旧迎新之际
data.enText: the time when a new century/year starts

data.chText: 这是在世纪之交修建的。
data.enText: It was built at the turn of the century.
a turn of mind
a particular way of thinking about things
a turn of phrase

data.chText: 措辞；表达方式；描述方式
data.enText: a particular way of describing sth
a turn of the screw
an extra amount of pressure, cruelty , etc. added to a situation that is already difficult to bear or understand
a turn of speed

data.chText: 突然加速；加快进度；突然加快的能力
data.enText: a sudden increase in your speed or rate of progress; the ability to suddenly increase your speed

data.chText: 他在最后一圈猛然加速。
data.enText: He put on an impressive turn of speed in the last lap.
not do a hand's turn
to do no work
She hasn't done a hand's turn all week.
serve your/its turn

data.chText: （在某方面或某期间）发挥作用，派上用场；足以满足…的需要
data.enText: to be useful for a particular purpose or period of time

data.chText: 这些动词常与下列形容词连用：
data.enText: These verbs are used frequently with the following adjectives.

data.chText: become较get正式。两者均指人的感情、身体状况、自然或社会的变化。
data.enText: Become is more formal than get . Both describe changes in people’s emotional or physical state, or natural or social changes.
Go is usually used for negative changes.

data.chText: go和turn均用以指颜色的变化。
data.enText: Go and turn are both used for changes of colour.
Turn is also used for changes in the weather.

ex.chText: 女巫把那男孩变成了一只老鼠。
ex.enText: A witch changed the boy into a mouse.

ex.chText: 经济形势已发生了相当大的变化。
ex.enText: The economic situation has changed considerably.
The leaves on the trees change colour in the autumn.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，可指任何变化，强调与原先的情况有明显的不同。

ex.chText: 你的外衣太大了，得找人改一下。
ex.enText: Your coat is too big. You must have it altered.

ex.chText: 工作环境必须改善，以适应新的要求。
ex.enText: The working condition must be altered to meet the new requirements.

synonyms.bx: 常指轻微改变，强调在保持原状的情况下进行局部改变。

ex.chText: 请把这钱兑换成人民币。
ex.enText: Please convert this money into RMB.
Her mother has converted to Catholicism.

synonyms.bx: 指改变形式、用途、使用方式等，也指改变信仰、观点、态度等。

ex.chText: 这项计划要用就必须修改。
ex.enText: The plan must be modified if it is to be used.

ex.chText: 你最好说得和缓些才是。

synonyms.bx: 指对某物作细小的改动以对其进行改进，使其更适用或更高效。

ex.chText: 魔术师把那条手帕变成了一只鸟。
ex.enText: The magician transformed the handkerchief into a bird.

ex.chText: 太阳能可以转化为能量。
ex.enText: Solar energy can be transformed into power.

synonyms.bx: 指在形式、外观、性质等方面彻底改变，即成为全新的东西。

ex.enText: Coal can be turned into heat.

ex.chText: 他把这本小说变成了英语畅销书。
ex.enText: He turned this novel into an English best-seller.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指外形、颜色、气味、性质等方面发生变化。

ex.chText: 鱼的价格随着市场行情而变化。
ex.enText: The prices of fish vary according to market conditions.

ex.chText: 老年人不喜欢改变他们的习惯。
ex.enText: Old people don't like to vary their habits.

synonyms.bx: 指根据某一情况的变化而变化，也指更改某事物。

data.chText: 大多数含 turn 的习语，都可在该等习语中的名词及形容词相关词条找到，如 not turn a hair 在词条 hair 下。
data.enText: Most idioms containing turn are at the entries for the nouns and adjectives in the idioms, for example not turn a hair is at hair .
as it/things turned out

data.chText: 正如后来表明的；果然如此；果不其然
data.enText: as was shown or proved by later events
I didn't need my umbrella, as it turned out (= because it didn't rain) .
be well, badly, etc. turned out

data.chText: 穿着打扮得好（或不好等）
data.enText: to be well, badly, etc. dressed
turn round/around and do sth

data.chText: （用以报告令人吃惊或不快的言行）竟会
data.enText: used to report what sb says or does, when this is surprising or annoying

data.chText: 我为她做了这么多，她怎么竟说出那种话来？
data.enText: How could she turn round and say that, after all I've done for her?
at every turn
everywhere or every time you try and do sth
At every turn I met with disappointment.
(do sb) a good turn

data.chText: （为某人做）好事，善事；（做）有助于某人的事
data.enText: (to do) sth that helps sb

data.chText: 好啦，这就是我今天做的好事。
data.enText: Well, that's my good turn for the day.
done to a turn
cooked for exactly the right amount of time
give sb a turn

data.chText: 使大吃一惊；吓某人一跳
data.enText: to frighten or shock sb
in turn
one after the other in a particular order
The children called out their names in turn.
as a result of sth in a series of events

data.chText: 增加生产会继而增加利润。
data.enText: Increased production will, in turn, lead to increased profits.
one good turn deserves another

data.chText: 善须善报；要以德报德；好人应得好报
data.enText: you should help sb who has helped you
on the turn
going to change soon
His luck is on the turn.
speak/talk out of turn

data.chText: 说话出格（或冒失、鲁莽、不合时宜）
data.enText: to say sth that you should not because it is the wrong situation or because it offends sb
take turns (in sth/to do sth)
take it in turns
if people take turns or take it in turns to do sth, they do it one after the other to make sure it is done fairly
The male and female birds take turns in sitting on the eggs.
We take it in turns to do the housework.
the turn of the century/year

data.chText: 世纪之交；新年伊始；辞旧迎新之际
data.enText: the time when a new century/year starts

data.chText: 这是在世纪之交修建的。
data.enText: It was built at the turn of the century.
a turn of mind
a particular way of thinking about things
a turn of phrase

data.chText: 措辞；表达方式；描述方式
data.enText: a particular way of describing sth
a turn of the screw
an extra amount of pressure, cruelty , etc. added to a situation that is already difficult to bear or understand
a turn of speed

data.chText: 突然加速；加快进度；突然加快的能力
data.enText: a sudden increase in your speed or rate of progress; the ability to suddenly increase your speed

data.chText: 他在最后一圈猛然加速。
data.enText: He put on an impressive turn of speed in the last lap.
not do a hand's turn
to do no work
She hasn't done a hand's turn all week.
serve your/its turn

data.chText: （在某方面或某期间）发挥作用，派上用场；足以满足…的需要
data.enText: to be useful for a particular purpose or period of time
turn against sb
turn sb against sb
to stop or make sb stop being friendly towards sb
She turned against her old friend.

data.chText: 他离婚后企图教唆子女反对他们的母亲。
data.enText: After the divorce he tried to turn the children against their mother.
turn around/round
turn sb/sth around/round
to change position or direction so as to face the other way; to make sb/sth do this

data.chText: 转过身去让我看看你的后背。
data.enText: Turn around and let me look at your back.

data.chText: 我把椅子转过来面向火炉。
data.enText: I turned my chair round to face the fire.
turn around/round
turn sth↔around/round

data.chText: （使企业、经济等）好转，扭转，有起色
data.enText: if a business, economy, etc. turns around or sb turns it around , it starts being successful after it has been unsuccessful for a time
turn sb↔away (from sth)

data.chText: 把某人拒之门外；不准某人进入
data.enText: to refuse to allow sb to enter a place

data.chText: 体育场满座，数百人被拒之门外。
data.enText: Hundreds of people were turned away from the stadium (= because it was full) .

data.chText: 他们无处安身，所以我不能把他们打发走。
data.enText: They had nowhere to stay so I couldn't turn them away.
turn back
turn sb/sth↔back
to return the way you have come; to make sb/sth do this

data.chText: 天气变得非常恶劣，他们不得不循原路折回。
data.enText: The weather became so bad that they had to turn back.

data.chText: 我们说过要干这事，不能反悔。
data.enText: We said we would do it─there can be no turning back.

data.chText: 我们的汽车在边境被挡了回来。
data.enText: Our car was turned back at the border.
turn sb/sth↔down

data.chText: 拒绝，顶回（提议、建议或提议人）
data.enText: to reject or refuse to consider an offer, a proposal, etc. or the person who makes it

data.chText: 她为什么谢绝你的邀请？
data.enText: Why did she turn down your invitation?

data.chText: 他迄今申请了十份工作都遭到拒绝。
data.enText: He has been turned down for ten jobs so far.

data.chText: 他请求她嫁给他，但是她回绝了。
data.enText: He asked her to marry him but she turned him down.
turn sth↔down
to reduce the noise, heat, etc. produced by a piece of equipment by moving its controls
Please turn the volume down.

data.chText: 他把灯光调得暗了一些。
data.enText: He turned the lights down low.
turn in
to face or curve towards the centre
Her feet turn in.
to go to bed
turn sb↔in

data.chText: 把…扭送（到警察局）；使自首
data.enText: to take sb to the police or sb in authority because they have committed a crime

data.chText: 她扬言要把他交给警方。
data.enText: She threatened to turn him in to the police.

data.chText: 他决定到警察局去自首。
data.enText: He decided to turn himself in.
turn sth↔in

data.chText: 交还，退还（不再需要的东西）
data.enText: to give back sth that you no longer need

data.chText: 你离开大楼时必须交还通行证。
data.enText: You must turn in your pass when you leave the building.
to give sth to sb in authority

data.chText: 他们递交了一份有8万人签名的请愿书。
data.enText: They turned in a petition with 80 000 signatures.

data.chText: 我连星期一的作业还没交呢。
data.enText: I haven't even turned in Monday's work yet.

data.chText: 取得（分数）；完成（表演）；获得（利润）
data.enText: to achieve a score, performance, profit, etc.

data.chText: 上届冠军表现十分出色，卫冕成功。
data.enText: The champion turned in a superb performance to retain her title.
turn in on yourself

data.chText: 忙于自己的事情而不与人交往；闭门谢客
data.enText: to become too concerned with your own problems and stop communicating with others
turn (from sth) into sth
to become sth

data.chText: 我们梦想的假日变成了一场噩梦。
data.enText: Our dream holiday turned into a nightmare.

data.chText: 一年内，她从问题儿童变成了模范学生。
data.enText: In one year she turned from a problem child into a model student.
turn sb/sth (from sth) into sth
to make sb/sth become sth

data.chText: 十年大狱使他变成了一个老头。
data.enText: Ten years of prison had turned him into an old man.

data.chText: 王子被女巫变成了一只青蛙。
data.enText: The prince was turned into a frog by the witch.
turn off
turn off sth
to leave a road in order to travel on another

data.chText: 这儿是我们换道的地方吗？
data.enText: Is this where we turn off?

data.chText: 那架喷气式飞机开始拐出主跑道。
data.enText: The jet began to turn off the main runway.
turn off
to stop listening to or thinking about sb/sth

data.chText: 我听不懂讲课，所以也就不听了。
data.enText: I couldn't understand the lecture so I just turned off.
turn sb↔off
to make sb feel bored or not interested

data.chText: 大选中的两位候选人都让人觉得扫兴。
data.enText: People had been turned off by both candidates in the election.

data.chText: 使（异性）失去兴趣；使厌恶
data.enText: to stop sb feeling sexually attracted; to make sb have a feeling of disgust
turn sth↔off

data.chText: 关掉，截断（电流、煤气、水等）
data.enText: to stop the flow of electricity, gas, water, etc. by moving a switch, button, etc.
to turn off the light
Please turn the television off before you go to bed.
turn on sb
to attack sb suddenly and unexpectedly

data.chText: 那两条狗突然互相撕咬了起来。
data.enText: The dogs suddenly turned on each other.

data.chText: 你们怎么突然都冲我来了？
data.enText: Why are you all turning on me (= criticizing or blaming me) ?
turn on sth
to depend on sth

data.chText: 事情主要取决于当前和谈的结果。
data.enText: Much turns on the outcome of the current peace talks.
to have sth as its main topic

data.chText: 这次讨论的主要议题是提高标准的必要性。
data.enText: The discussion turned on the need to raise standards.
turn sb↔on
to make sb excited or interested, especially sexually

data.chText: 我对爵士乐从未真正产生过兴趣。
data.enText: Jazz has never really turned me on.

data.chText: 她看到穿制服的男人就欲火攻心。
data.enText: She gets turned on by men in uniform.
turn sb on (to sth)

data.chText: 使对…感兴趣；使首次使用
data.enText: to make sb become interested in sth or to use sth for the first time

data.chText: 他使她对爵士乐产生了兴趣。
data.enText: He turned her on to jazz.
turn sth↔on

data.chText: 接通（电流、煤气、水等）；打开
data.enText: to start the flow of electricity, gas, water, etc. by moving a switch, button, etc.
to turn on the heating
I'll turn the television on.

data.chText: 他确实懂得如何一展魅力。
data.enText: He really knows how to turn on the charm (= suddenly become pleasant and attractive) .
turn out
to be present at an event

data.chText: 有一大群人出来观看游行队伍。
data.enText: A vast crowd turned out to watch the procession.

before.chText: 与副词或形容词连用，或用于以how引导的疑问句
before.enText: used with an adverb or adjective, or in questions with how

data.enText: to happen in a particular way; to develop or end in a particular way

data.chText: 尽管我们都很担心，结果一切都顺利。
data.enText: Despite our worries everything turned out well.

data.chText: 很难说子女将来的发展怎样。
data.enText: You never know how your children will turn out.

data.chText: 如果那天下雨的话，我们可能得改变计划。
data.enText: If the day turns out wet, we may have to change our plans.
to point away from the centre
Her toes turn out.
to be discovered to be; to prove to be

data.chText: 她原来是我姐姐的朋友。
data.enText: It turned out that she was a friend of my sister.

data.chText: 这工作结果比我们想象的要难。
data.enText: The job turned out to be harder than we thought.

data.chText: 他们向我们提供的房子原来是很小的公寓套间。
data.enText: The house they had offered us turned out to be a tiny apartment.
turn sb/sth↔out

data.chText: 制造；生产；以（…装束等）出现
data.enText: to produce sb/sth

data.chText: 这家工厂每周生产900辆汽车。
data.enText: The factory turns out 900 cars a week.
turn sb out (of/from sth)
to force sb to leave a place
turn sth↔out
to switch a light or a source of heat off
Remember to turn out the lights when you go to bed.
to clean sth thoroughly by removing the contents and organizing them again
to turn out the attic
to empty sth, especially your pockets
to make sth point away from the centre
She turned her toes out.
turn over
to change position so that the other side is facing towards the outside or the top

data.chText: 你若翻个身，也许入睡容易些。
data.enText: If you turn over you might find it easier to get to sleep.

data.chText: 汽车打滑向一侧翻倒了。
data.enText: The car skidded and turned over.
The smell made my stomach turn over (= made me feel sick) .
to start or to continue to run
to change to another channel when you are watching television
turn over sth

data.chText: 营业额为…；做金额为…的生意
data.enText: to do business worth a particular amount of money in a particular period of time

data.chText: 这家公司一年的营业额为350万英镑。
data.enText: The company turns over £3.5 million a year.
turn sth↔over
to make sth change position so that the other side is facing towards the outside or the top

data.chText: 把肉的一面烤黄，然后翻转过来，再烤另一面。
data.enText: Brown the meat on one side, then turn it over and brown the other side.
to think about sth carefully

data.chText: 她脑子里不断琢磨当天发生的事。
data.enText: She kept turning over the events of the day in her mind.
to sell goods and replace them

data.chText: 超级市场的货物周转得很快。
data.enText: A supermarket will turn over its stock very rapidly.
to steal from a place

data.chText: 盗贼把这所房子盗窃一空。
data.enText: Burglars had turned the house over.
to make an engine start running
turn sb↔over to sb

data.chText: 移交，送交（他人看管，尤指当局）
data.enText: to deliver sb to the control or care of sb else, especially sb in authority

data.chText: 海关官员把那个男子移交给警方看管。
data.enText: Customs officials turned the man over to the police.
turn sth↔over to sb
to give the control of sth to sb

data.chText: 他把这个企业交给了女儿管理。
data.enText: He turned the business over to his daughter.
turn sth↔over to sth
to change the use or function of sth

data.chText: 这家工厂转产飞机部件。
data.enText: The factory was turned over to the manufacture of aircraft parts.
turn to sb/sth
to go to sb/sth for help, advice, etc.
She has nobody she can turn to.
turn up

data.chText: （尤指失去后偶然）被发现，被找到
data.enText: to be found, especially by chance, after being lost

data.chText: 别为那封信担心，我相信会找到的。
data.enText: Don't worry about the letter─I'm sure it'll turn up.
to arrive

data.chText: 我们约好7:30碰头，但她根本没露面。
data.enText: We arranged to meet at 7.30, but she never turned up.
to happen, especially by chance

data.chText: 他仍然在希望会有机会出现。
data.enText: He's still hoping something (= for example, a job or a piece of luck) will turn up.
turn sth↔up
to increase the sound, heat, etc. of a piece of equipment

data.chText: 你能把电视机的音量开大些吗？
data.enText: Could you turn the TV up?
The music was turned up loud.

data.chText: 将（衣服的底边）折起缝好；改短
data.enText: to make a piece of clothing shorter by folding and sewing it up at the bottom
to find sth

data.chText: 我们辛辛苦苦跟踪他，却无功而返。
data.enText: Our efforts to trace him turned up nothing.

trans: 改变（问题、句子或想法的）表达方式
（尤指为指责别人或捍卫自己）话锋突转
无法改变计划；无法收回成命
拒绝（某人或其请求、提议等）
把（犯罪嫌疑人）交给警方；告发；检举；自首
驶离，离开（…路）；转弯；拐入旁路
关上；关掉；截断，切断（…的供应）
使没有性欲；使失去性欲
对…进行身体（或语言）攻击；斥责
（以某种方式）发生；最后是；结果是
（尤指把某人从其长期居住处）撵走，赶出，逐出
（在脑子里）仔细考虑，深思熟虑，细想
（向有权获得某物的人）移交，交托
把…改造成…；改变，转变（功能或用途）
（常指出其不意地或经长久等待后）出现，到来，露面
开大，调高（收音机、暖气等）

tr: taking a short walk out and back
example: we took a turn in the park

tr: turning or twisting around (in place)
example: with a quick twist of his head he surveyed the room

tr: the act of turning away or in the opposite direction
example: he made an abrupt turn away from her

tr: the act of changing or reversing the direction of the course
example: he took a turn to the right

tr: (game) the activity of doing something in an agreed succession
example: it is my turn
it is still my play

tr: a favor for someone
example: he did me a good turn

tr: a short theatrical performance that is part of a longer program
example: he did his act three times every evening
she had a catchy little routine
it was one of the best numbers he ever did

tr: a movement in a new direction
example: the turning of the wind

tr: an unforeseen development
example: events suddenly took an awkward turn

tr: a circular segment of a curve
example: a bend in the road
a crook in the path

tr: (sports) a division during which one team is on the offensive
a time for working (after which you will be relieved by someone else)
example: it's my go
a spell of work

tr: twist suddenly so as to sprain
example: wrench one's ankle
The wrestler twisted his shoulder
the hikers sprained their ankles when they fell
I turned my ankle and couldn't walk for several days

tr: pass into a condition gradually, take on a specific property or attribute
become
example: The weather turned nasty
She grew angry

tr: change to the contrary
example: The trend was reversed
the tides turned against him
public opinion turned when it was revealed that the president had an affair with a White House intern

tr: undergo a transformation or a change of position or action
example: We turned from Socialism to Capitalism
The people turned against the President when he stole the election

tr: become officially one year older
example: She is turning 50 this year

tr: change color
example: In Vermont, the leaves turn early

tr: go sour or spoil
example: The milk has soured
The wine worked
The cream has turned--we have to throw it out

tr: have recourse to or make an appeal or request for help or information to
example: She called on her Representative to help her
She turned to her relatives for help

tr: direct at someone
example: She turned a smile on me
They turned their flashlights on the car

tr: alter the functioning or setting of
example: turn the dial to 10
turn the heat down

tr: cause (a plastic object) to assume a crooked or angular form
example: bend the rod
twist the dough into a braid
the strong man could turn an iron bar

tr: let (something) fall or spill from a container
example: turn the flour onto a plate

tr: shape by rotating on a lathe or cutting device or a wheel
example: turn the legs of the table
turn the clay on the wheel

tr: to break and turn over earth especially with a plow
example: Farmer Jones plowed his east field last week
turn the earth in the Spring

tr: change orientation or direction, also in the abstract sense
example: Turn towards me
The mugger turned and fled before I could see his face
She turned from herself and learned to listen to others' needs

tr: pass to the other side of
example: turn the corner
move around the obstacle

tr: channel one's attention, interest, thought, or attention toward or away from something
example: The pedophile turned to boys for satisfaction
people turn to mysticism at the turn of a millennium

tr: to send or let go
example: They turned away the crowd at the gate of the governor's mansion

tr: cause to move around a center so as to show another side of
example: turn a page of a book

tr: cause to move around or rotate
example: turn a key
turn your palm this way

tr: cause to move along an axis or into a new direction
example: turn your face to the wall
turn the car around
turn your dance partner around

tr: move around an axis or a center
example: The wheels are turning

tr: get by buying and selling
example: the company turned a good profit after a year

tr: accomplish by rotating
example: turn a somersault
turn cartwheels

tr: undergo a change or development
example: The water turned into ice
Her former friend became her worst enemy
He turned traitor

tr: cause to change or turn into something different
ssume new characteristics
example: The princess turned the frog into a prince by kissing him
The alchemists tried to turn lead into gold

value.def: When you turn or when you turn part of your body, you move your body or part of your body so that it is facing in a different or opposite direction.

example.ex: He turned abruptly and walked away...
example.tran: 他突然转身走了。

example.ex: He turned to his publicist and jokingly asked, 'What's next?'…
example.tran: 他转向他的宣传员开玩笑地问道：“下一个是什么？”

example.ex: He sighed, turning away and surveying the sea...
example.tran: 他叹口气，转身远眺大海。

example.ex: He turned his head left and right...
example.tran: 他左右转动脑袋。

example.ex: He waited for the woman to turn her face back to the road.
example.tran: 他等待那个女人把脸转回路这边。

posc.def: Turn around or turn round means the same as turn .
posc.tran: turn around 或 turn round 同 turn

example.ex: I felt a tapping on my shoulder and I turned around...
example.tran: 我感到有人拍了一下我的肩膀，于是转过身去。

example.ex: Turn your upper body round so that your shoulders are facing to the side.
example.tran: 转动上身，让双肩朝向一侧。

value.def: When you turn something, you move it so that it is facing in a different or opposite direction, or is in a very different position.

example.ex: They turned their telescopes towards other nearby galaxies...
example.tran: 他们把望远镜转向附近其他星系。

example.ex: Turn the cake the right way up on to a wire rack…
example.tran: 把蛋糕翻到合适的方向对准金属丝架上。

example.ex: I turned my jacket inside out…
example.tran: 我把夹克衫翻了个面。

example.ex: She had turned the bedside chair to face the door...
example.tran: 她把床头椅转向正对门的方向。

example.ex: The lid, turned upside down, served as a coffee table.
example.tran: 那个盖子被翻过来当作咖啡桌。

value.tran: 转动;使转向;使改变方向

value.def: When something such as a wheel turns, or when you turn it, it continually moves around in a particular direction.

example.ex: As the wheel turned, the potter shaped the clay...
example.tran: 轮子一边转动，制陶工人一边拉坯。

example.ex: The engine turned a propeller.
example.tran: 发动机使螺旋桨旋转起来。

value.def: When you turn something such as a key, knob, or switch, or when it turns, you hold it and twist your hand, in order to open something or make it start working.

example.ex: Turn a special key, press the brake pedal, and your car's brakes lock...
example.tran: 转动一把特制的钥匙，踩下刹车踏板，这样你的汽车刹车就锁住了。

example.ex: Turn the heat to very low and cook for 20 minutes...
example.tran: 把温度调到很低，煮 20 分钟。

example.ex: I tried the doorknob and it turned.
example.tran: 我试了试门把手，结果它转动了。

value.tran: 转动，旋动(钥匙、把手、开关等)

value.def: When you turn in a particular direction or turn a corner, you change the direction in which you are moving or travelling.

example.ex: He turned into the narrow terraced street where he lived…
example.tran: 他转向自己居住的那条夹在排房间的狭窄街道。

example.ex: Now turn right to follow West Ferry Road...
example.tran: 现在向右拐沿西渡路往前走。

example.ex: The man with the umbrella turned the corner again.
example.tran: 拿伞的人又拐进了拐角处。

example.ex: You can't do a right-hand turn here.
example.tran: 此处禁止右拐。

value.def: The point where a road, path, or river turns, is the point where it has a bend or curve in it.

example.ex: ...the corner where Tenterfield Road turned into the main road.
example.tran: 滕特菲尔德路拐向主道的岔路口

example.ex: ...a sharp turn in the road.
example.tran: 路上的急转弯

value.def: When the tide turns, it starts coming in or going out.

example.ex: There was not much time before the tide turned.
example.tran: 不久就要涨潮了。

value.def: When someone turns a cartwheel or a somersault, they do a cartwheel or somersault.

example.ex: They were still doing wild acrobatics in the yard, turning somersaults and cartwheels.
example.tran: 他们还在院子里一通杂耍，翻着跟头，玩着侧手翻。

value.def: When you turn a page of a book or magazine, you move it so that is flat against the previous page, and you can read the next page.

example.ex: He turned the pages of a file in front of him.
example.tran: 他翻阅面前的文件。

value.def: If you turn a weapon or an aggressive feeling on someone, you point it at them or direct it at them.

example.ex: He tried to turn the gun on me...
example.tran: 他企图把枪对准我。

example.ex: The crowd then turned their anger on Prime Minister James Mitchell.
example.tran: 然后人群把怒火都撒向詹姆斯·米切尔总理。

value.def: If you turn to a particular page in a book or magazine, you open it at that page.

example.ex: To order, turn to page 236.
example.tran: 如需订购，参见 236 页。

value.def: If you turn your attention or thoughts to a particular subject or if you turn to it, you start thinking about it or discussing it.

example.ex: We turned our attention to the practical matters relating to forming a company...
example.tran: 我们开始考虑有关成立公司的具体事宜。

example.ex: We turn now to the British news.
example.tran: 我们现在来关注英国新闻。

value.tran: 开始思考;开始讨论;把(注意力等)转向

value.def: If you turn to someone, you ask for their help or advice.

example.ex: For assistance, they turned to one of the city's most innovative museums...
example.tran: 他们求助于该市最具创新风格的一家博物馆。

example.ex: There was no one to turn to, no one to tell.
example.tran: 没人可以求助，没人可以诉说。

value.def: If you turn to a particular activity, job, or way of doing something, you start doing or using it.

example.ex: These communities are now turning to recycling in large numbers...
example.tran: 这些团体现在正转而致力于大规模的回收利用工作。

example.ex: The Superpowers turned to the harder task of cutting their nuclear arsenals…
example.tran: 超级大国开始着手削减核武器库这项更为艰难的工作。

example.ex: Universities are turning from academic to commercial sponsorship.
example.tran: 各大学正从学术赞助转而寻求商业赞助。

value.def: To turn or be turned into something means to become that thing.

example.ex: A prince turns into a frog in this cartoon fairytale...
example.tran: 在这个卡通童话里王子变成了一只青蛙。

example.ex: Their grief turned to hysteria when the funeral procession arrived at the cemetery…
example.tran: 当送葬队走到墓地时，他们更加悲恸欲绝。

example.ex: The hated dictator had turned his country into one of the poorest police states in Europe...
example.tran: 这个为人深恶痛绝的独裁者把他的国家变成了欧洲最贫穷的极权国家之一。

example.ex: He soon turned his dreams to reality.
example.tran: 他不久便梦想成真了。

example.ex: …an MP turned diplomat.
example.tran: 成为外交官的下院议员

value.def: You can use turn before an adjective to indicate that something or someone changes by acquiring the quality described by the adjective.

example.ex: If the bailiff thinks that things could turn nasty he will enlist the help of the police...
example.tran: 如果法警认为事情变得不可收拾，他就会寻求警方的帮助。

example.ex: She announced that she was going to turn professional.
example.tran: 她宣布自己即将成为职业选手。

value.def: If something turns a particular colour or if something turns it a particular colour, it becomes that colour.

example.ex: The sea would turn pale pink and the sky blood red...
example.tran: 大海会变成浅粉色，天空则变成血红色。

example.ex: Her contact lenses turned her eyes green.
example.tran: 隐形眼镜把她的眼睛变成了绿色。

value.def: You can use turn to indicate that there is a change to a particular kind of weather. For example, if it turns cold, the weather starts being cold.

example.ex: If it turns cold, cover plants...
example.tran: 如果天气变冷，就把植物盖起来。

example.ex: The weather had turned warm and thundery overnight.
example.tran: 天气一夜之间就转暖，而且雷声阵阵。

value.def: If a situation or trend takes a particular kind of turn, it changes so that it starts developing in a different or opposite way.

example.ex: The scandal took a new turn over the weekend.
example.tran: 周末时丑闻有了新的发展。

example.ex: …the latest turn in the fighting…
example.tran: 战斗的最新进展

example.ex: Retailers have given up waiting for a turn in the housing market.
example.tran: 零售商们已放弃等待房产市场上的转机。

value.tran: (时局或趋势的)逆转，转变，变化

value.def: In sports, if a game turns, or is turned, something significant happens which changes the way the game is developing.

example.ex: The game turned in the 56th minute.
example.tran: 比赛在第 56 分钟时发生了扭转。

example.ex: …the Gareth Edwards try which turned the game between France and Wales in Paris in 1971.
example.tran: 加雷思·爱德华兹于 1971 年法国队与威尔士队在巴黎的比赛中贡献的一记扭转赛事的触地得分

value.def: If a business turns a profit, it earns more money than it spends.

example.ex: The firm will be able to service debt and still turn a modest profit...
example.tran: 那家公司将有能力支付债务，而且还会赚得一笔可观的利润。

example.ex: He says the fares are just too low to turn profits.
example.tran: 他说票价太低，根本无利可图。

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 make, return

value.def: When someone turns a particular age, they pass that age. When it turns a particular time, it passes that time.

example.ex: It was his ambition to accumulate a million dollars before he turned thirty...
example.tran: 他立志要在而立之年以前攒够 100 万美元。

example.ex: It had just turned twelve o'clock.
example.tran: 刚过 12 点。

value.def: Turn is used in expressions such as the turn of the century and the turn of the year to refer to a period of time when one century or year is ending and the next one is beginning.

example.ex: They fled to South America around the turn of the century.
example.tran: 他们在世纪之交逃到了南美洲。

value.def: When someone turns a wooden or metal object that they are making, they shape it using a special tool.

example.ex: ...the joys of making a living from turning wood.
example.tran: 靠车削木材谋生的乐趣

example.ex: …finely-turned metal.
example.tran: 精心车削的金属

value.def: If it is your turn to do something, you now have the duty, chance, or right to do it, when other people have done it before you or will do it after you.

example.ex: Tonight it's my turn to cook...
example.tran: 今晚该我做饭了。

example.ex: Let each child have a turn at fishing...
example.tran: 让每个孩子轮流钓鱼。

example.ex: Students are expected to take their turn leading the study group.
example.tran: 学生们要依次轮流当学习小组的组长。

gramarinfo.label: usu with poss, oft N to-inf, N <l>at</l> -ing, N -ing

value.tran: (依次轮流时的)轮班，次序，轮番

value.def: If you say that someone is having a turn, you mean they feel suddenly very unwell for a short period of time.

example.ex: He is having one of his turns…
example.tran: 他又犯病了。

example.ex: He gets funny turns, you know. It's his age.
example.tran: 他总是感觉不舒服。也是，他都这个岁数了。

value.def: You can use by turns to indicate that someone has two particular emotions or qualities, one after the other.

example.ex: His tone was by turns angry and aggrieved.
example.tran: 他的语气时而透着愤怒，时而流露出哀怨。

gramarinfo.label: PHR with group, PHR with v

value.tran: （表示两种感情或品质的交替）时而，间或

value.def: If there is a particular turn of events, a particular series of things happen.

example.ex: They were horrified at this unexpected turn of events.
example.tran: 这种出乎意料的形势变化让他们无比震惊。

value.def: If you say that something happens at every turn, you are emphasizing that it happens frequently or all the time, usually so that it prevents you from achieving what you want.

example.ex: Its operations were hampered at every turn by inadequate numbers of trained staff...
example.tran: 因为缺乏训练有素的员工，其生产经营总是遇到各种障碍。

example.ex: At every turn smoke and flame stopped efforts to get into the living quarters.
example.tran: 到处是烟雾和火焰，根本无法进入住处。

gramarinfo.label: PHR after v, PHR with cl

value.def: If you do someone a good turn, you do something that helps or benefits them.

example.ex: He did you a good turn by resigning...
example.tran: 他辞职对你有利。

example.ex: One good turn deserves another.
example.tran: 善有善报。

value.def: If someone turns a place inside out or upside down, they search it very thoroughly and usually make it very untidy.

example.ex: They hadn't found a scrap of evidence though they had turned his flat inside out.
example.tran: 他们虽然把他的公寓翻了个底朝天，却没有找到一丝证据。

value.tran: 彻底搜查;把…翻个底朝天

value.def: If something such as a system or way of life is turned inside out or upside down, it is changed completely, making people confused or upset.

example.ex: He felt too shocked to move. His world had been turned upside down.
example.tran: 他惊呆了。他的世界已经完全被打乱了。

value.tran: 彻底改变，完全搅乱（体制或生活方式）

value.def: You use in turn to refer to actions or events that are in a sequence one after the other, for example because one causes the other.

example.ex: One of the members of the surgical team leaked the story to a fellow physician who, in turn, confided in a reporter.
example.tran: 手术小组的一名成员把这个消息泄露给了在一起工作的一个内科医生，后者又透露给了一位记者。

value.def: If each person in a group does something in turn, they do it one after the other in a fixed or agreed order.

example.ex: There were cheers for each of the women as they spoke in turn.
example.tran: 当这些女人们逐一发言时，她们每个人都赢得了喝彩声。

value.def: If someone is of a particular turn of mind, they have that kind of mind or character.

example.ex: She was of a rational turn of mind.
example.tran: 她是个理性的人。

value.def: If you speak out of turn or talk out of turn, you say something that you do not have the right or authority to say.

example.ex: I hope I haven't spoken out of turn.
example.tran: 希望我没有多嘴。

value.def: If a person, animal, or vehicle has a good turn of speed, they have the ability to move fast.
If two or more people take turns to do something, or in British English take it in turns to do something, they do it one after the other several times, rather than doing it together.

example.ex: We took turns to drive the car...
example.tran: 我们轮流开车。

example.ex: Ted and I took it in turns to go into hospital and sit with Emma.
example.tran: 我和特德轮流去医院陪护埃玛。

value.def: If a situation takes a turn for the worse, it suddenly becomes worse. If a situation takes a turn for the better, it suddenly becomes better.

example.ex: Her condition took a sharp turn for the worse.
example.tran: 她的病情突然急剧恶化。

usage_note.note: Turn is used in a large number of other expressions which are explained under other words in the dictionary. For example, the expression ‘turn over a new leaf’ is explained at leaf.
usage_note.translation: turn 还有许多其他用法，在本词典其他词条下作了解释。例如，turn over a new leaf 这一表达在 leaf 词条下作了解释。

trans: （表示两种感情或品质的交替）时而，间或
转动；转身；扭转；（使）调转方向；（使）转向；（使）复苏；（使）好转；改变（问题、句子或想法的）表达方式；（尤指为指责别人或捍卫自己）话锋突转
拒绝…进入；弃用（方法、主意）
拒绝（某人或其请求、提议等）；关小；调低
调大；出现；（常指出其不意地或经长久等待后）出现，到来，露面；找出；发现；注意到；开大，调高（收音机、暖气等）
往回走；（使）返回；（使）折回；无法改变计划；无法收回成命
上床睡觉；把（犯罪嫌疑人）交给警方；告发；检举；自首；上交；提交；交付；交还；返还
转动；转身；扭转；（使）调转方向；（使）转向；（使）复苏；（使）好转；改变（问题、句子或想法的）表达方式；（尤指为指责别人或捍卫自己）话锋突转
（使）翻转；（使）颠倒；（使）倾覆；翻身；（在脑子里）仔细考虑，深思熟虑，细想；（向有权获得某物的人）移交，交托；移交（职位、责任）；换频道；转台
（以某种方式）发生；最后是；结果是；（尤指天气突然）变得（晴好）；原来是；结果发现；关掉，熄灭（电灯、煤气等）；生产；制造；（尤指把某人从其长期居住处）撵走，赶出，逐出；翻出；倒出；出席；参加；前去观看
打开；接通（…的供应）；诱惑；激发…的性欲；突然表现得；突然装出；对…进行身体（或语言）攻击；斥责；依靠
关掉；驶离，离开（…路）；转弯；拐入旁路；关上；截断，切断（…的供应）；使丧失兴趣；使没有性欲；使失去性欲
反过来；继而；转而；逐一；轮流地
